meanings.definition: The quality of being equal in value or worth.
meanings.sent1: Her equabilities in the team made her a valuable member.
meanings.sent2: The equabilities of the two items were compared before making a decision.
meanings.sent3: The equabilities of the twins often led to confusion among their friends.
meanings.sent4: In the world of art, the equabilities of different paintings can be subjective.
meanings.sent5: The equabilities of the gems made it hard to determine their true value.

meanings.definition: The ability to maintain composure or calmness in difficult situations.
meanings.sent1: His equabilities during the crisis helped keep everyone calm.
meanings.sent2: The equabilities she displayed during the interview impressed the panel.
meanings.sent3: Even in the face of chaos, his equabilities shone through.
meanings.sent4: Her equabilities were like a lighthouse in the stormy sea of emotions.
meanings.sent5: The equabilities of the leader inspired confidence in the team.
